HL7 Standard.summary: This Implementation Guide (IG) focuses on electronic case reporting (eCR) using FHIR. It heavily relies on FHIR for its core structure and operations, defining FHIR profiles, extensions, and transactions for eICR, RR, and eRSD. While it acknowledges CDA through its relationship with previous CDA-based IGs, it doesn't actively utilize CDA structures. The IG doesn't use v2 or v3 directly. It demonstrates a degree of cross-paradigm awareness by referencing prior CDA work and aiming for future alignment with the US Public Health Library, but its primary focus is on FHIR.

Geographic Scope.summary: This Implementation Guide focuses on electronic case reporting (eCR) within the United States. It defines FHIR-based transactions for the electronic Initial Case Report (eICR), the Reportability Response (RR), and the electronic Reporting and Surveillance Distribution (eRSD), covering all reportable conditions across all jurisdictions within the United States. It leverages US Core profiles and is designed for the US healthcare ecosystem.

Domain Focus.summary: This FHIR Implementation Guide focuses on automating electronic case reporting (eCR) from Electronic Health Records (EHRs) to Public Health Agencies (PHAs). It defines FHIR-based transactions for the electronic Initial Case Report (eICR), the Reportability Response (RR), and the electronic Reporting and Surveillance Distribution (eRSD). The primary goal is to improve the timeliness, completeness, and accuracy of case reporting data for public health surveillance, outbreak management, and control. While it touches upon clinical data and workflow, its core is driven by public health needs and the exchange of information between healthcare providers and public health entities.

Implementers.summary: This IG focuses on automating electronic case reporting (eCR) from EHRs to Public Health Agencies. Therefore, EHR and Public Health Systems are the primary implementers. Clinical Decision Support systems play a role in triggering and evaluating reportability. Payer systems have minimal involvement, primarily related to receiving notifications about reportable conditions. Other systems have limited or no involvement.

Users & Stakeholders.summary: This FHIR Implementation Guide (IG) primarily focuses on automating electronic case reporting (eCR) between healthcare providers and public health agencies.  Clinical care teams are the primary generators of the data, while public health agencies are the primary consumers and drivers of the reporting requirements. The IG also impacts EHR vendors and health IT systems that need to implement these standards. Payers and research organizations have a minimal role in this specific IG.
